content: I think President Obama will eventually regret his selection of Hillary Clinton as Sec of State. It's a bit too early to pass judgement, but from what little I have observed thus far it seems that Hillary has a compunction to act unilaterally and perhaps without full consent from President Obama. For example, she has publically voiced harsh comments towards N. Korea, Iran and Hamas - comments that may not be consistent with White House foreign policy objectives. IMO, Hillary will do anything and everything to keep herself in the limelight, including statements and actions designed to showcase her qualifications and to demonstrate the fact that (in her opinion) she should be POTUS rather than Barak Obama. I foresee a clash of personalities between the two that will create havoc in our State Department and foreign affairs.
reply: I think President Obama will eventually regret his selection of Hillary Clinton as Sec of State. It's a bit too early to pass judgement, but from what little I have observed thus far it seems that Hillary has a compunction to act unilaterally and perhaps without full consent from President Obama. For example, she has publically voiced harsh comments towards N. Korea, Iran and Hamas - comments that may not be consistent with White House foreign policy objectives. IMO, Hillary will do anything and everything to keep herself in the limelight, including statements and actions designed to showcase her qualifications and to demonstrate the fact that (in her opinion) she should be POTUS rather than Barak Obama. I foresee a clash of personalities between the two that will create havoc in our State Department and foreign affairs.

content: I see something here that few have considered. Clinton and Rice, in my not so humble opinion suffer from the same fatal flaw as Secretary's of State. I say what I'm about to say not in a sexist light but a practical one. Right now and for several years gone by Our biggest concern is with the various Arab nations. For thousands of years Arabs have held women in very low esteem. I don't think any of the Arab leaders have much respect for any woman including Clinton. With that in mind it hardly seems necessary to address her competence. How come I pressed "One for English" and still can't understand a word the dude is saying?

content: quote: Originally posted by GunnyRet03: quote: Originally posted by 1WW: How can you rate her, when she hasn't done anything? (I don't like her. Never did.) She: Went begging for money from china. Alienated Israel. off the top of my head. The funniest (tragically) thing she did, she did way before her current appointment. I think it was two years ago when she claimed (rightfully, but foolishly so) “This is the president that looked into the soul of Putin, I could have told him, he was a KGB agent, by definition he doesn’t have a soul." To which Putin replied: "At a minimum, a head of state should have a head,". Ouch. Way to publicly set the stage for future relationships Madam Secretary. She did it to malign Bush. Her little joke's real effect was to further dent the relations between the US and Russia. It played right into Putin's hands. He leads a culture that often views strength and the ability to act brutally when needed, as a virtue. She obviously did not care or understand what she was doing. My advice to the Secretary of State when dealing with an Evil Empire who cherishes brutal force and simplicity is to stop with all the cutesy little jokes and be brutally forceful. Call Evil "Evil" and then have done with it. It's worked in the past.

content: quote: Lead the world by example, not demand that they follow! More foreign aid given than any other nation in history. The defeat of two totalitarian empires and the containment of a third in this last century. In two hundred years has provided the world a stage and setting for exponentially unprecedented scientific and technological advancements. Flight, effective mass production, intelligent agriculture, space exploration, nuclear power, medicine, oceanography, technology, international disaster aid and rescue... The consistently peaceful exchange and assumption of power by two differing governing factions. One of the oldest intact, working and largely unchanged political systems... The liberation of more souls from oppression than any other nation in history... I give you the United States of America. Shattering Evil Empires and liberating the truly oppressed for two hundred years. And oh yes, still, after all this time, guaranteeing the shallow and mean-spirited the right to whine and hate themselves and their own national identity publicly.

content: I think President Obama will eventually regret his selection of Hillary Clinton as Sec of State. It's a bit too early to pass judgement, but from what little I have observed thus far it seems that Hillary has a compunction to act unilaterally and perhaps without full consent from President Obama. For example, she has publically voiced harsh comments towards N. Korea, Iran and Hamas - comments that may not be consistent with White House foreign policy objectives. IMO, Hillary will do anything and everything to keep herself in the limelight, including statements and actions designed to showcase her qualifications and to demonstrate the fact that (in her opinion) she should be POTUS rather than Barak Obama. I foresee a clash of personalities between the two that will create havoc in our State Department and foreign affairs.
reply: I think President Obama will eventually regret his selection of Hillary Clinton as Sec of State. content: I see something here that few have considered. Clinton and Rice, in my not so humble opinion suffer from the same fatal flaw as Secretary's of State. I say what I'm about to say not in a sexist light but a practical one. Right now and for several years gone by Our biggest concern is with the various Arab nations. For thousands of years Arabs have held women in very low esteem. I don't think any of the Arab leaders have much respect for any woman including Clinton. With that in mind it hardly seems necessary to address her competence. How come I pressed "One for English" and still can't understand a word the dude is saying?

content: quote: Originally posted by GunnyRet03: quote: Originally posted by 1WW: How can you rate her, when she hasn't done anything? (I don't like her. Never did.) She: Went begging for money from china. Alienated Israel. off the top of my head. The funniest (tragically) thing she did, she did way before her current appointment. I think it was two years ago when she claimed (rightfully, but foolishly so) “This is the president that looked into the soul of Putin, I could have told him, he was a KGB agent, by definition he doesn’t have a soul." To which Putin replied: "At a minimum, a head of state should have a head,". Ouch. Way to publicly set the stage for future relationships Madam Secretary. She did it to malign Bush. Her little joke's real effect was to further dent the relations between the US and Russia. It played right into Putin's hands. He leads a culture that often views strength and the ability to act brutally when needed, as a virtue. She obviously did not care or understand what she was doing. My advice to the Secretary of State when dealing with an Evil Empire who cherishes brutal force and simplicity is to stop with all the cutesy little jokes and be brutally forceful. Call Evil "Evil" and then have done with it. It's worked in the past.
quote: Originally posted by GunnyRet03: quote: Originally posted by 1WW: How can you rate her, when she hasn't done anything? (I don't like her. Never did.) She: Went begging for money from china. Alienated Israel. off the top of my head.

He leads a culture that often views strength and the ability to act brutally when needed, as a virtue. She obviously did not care or understand what she was doing. My advice to the Secretary of State when dealing with an Evil Empire who cherishes brutal force and simplicity is to stop with all the cutesy little jokes and be brutally forceful. content: quote: Lead the world by example, not demand that they follow! More foreign aid given than any other nation in history. The defeat of two totalitarian empires and the containment of a third in this last century. In two hundred years has provided the world a stage and setting for exponentially unprecedented scientific and technological advancements. Flight, effective mass production, intelligent agriculture, space exploration, nuclear power, medicine, oceanography, technology, international disaster aid and rescue... The consistently peaceful exchange and assumption of power by two differing governing factions. One of the oldest intact, working and largely unchanged political systems... The liberation of more souls from oppression than any other nation in history... I give you the United States of America. Shattering Evil Empires and liberating the truly oppressed for two hundred years. And oh yes, still, after all this time, guaranteeing the shallow and mean-spirited the right to whine and hate themselves and their own national identity publicly.
quote: Lead the world by example, not demand that they follow!
